TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed OdbcType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the data type of a field, property, for use in an .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following table shows mappings between OdbcType data types, ODBC data types (shown in parentheses), and .NET Framework types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType BigInt = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Exact numeric value with precision 19 (if signed) or 20 (if unsigned) and scale 0 (signed: –2[63] <= n <= 2[63] – 1, unsigned:0 <= n <= 2[64] – 1) (SQL_BIGINT). This maps to <xref:System.Int64>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Binary = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A stream of binary data (SQL_BINARY). This maps to an <xref:System.Array> of type <xref:System.Byte>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Bit = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Single bit binary data (SQL_BIT). This maps to <xref:System.Boolean>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Char = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A fixed-length character string (SQL_CHAR). This maps to <xref:System.String>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Date = int32(23)

Docs.summary: Date data in the format yyyymmdd (SQL_TYPE_DATE). This maps to <xref:System.DateTime>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType DateTime = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Date data in the format yyyymmddhhmmss (SQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP). This maps to <xref:System.DateTime>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Decimal = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Signed, exact, numeric value with a precision of at least p and scale s, where 1 <= p <= 15 and s <= p. The maximum precision is driver-specific (SQL_DECIMAL). This maps to <xref:System.Decimal>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Double = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Signed, approximate, numeric value with a binary precision 53 (zero or absolute value 10[–308] to 10[308]) (SQL_DOUBLE). This maps to <xref:System.Double>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Image = int32(9)

Docs.summary: Variable length binary data. Maximum length is data source–dependent (SQL_LONGVARBINARY). This maps to an <xref:System.Array> of type <xref:System.Byte>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Int = int32(10)

Docs.summary: Exact numeric value with precision 10 and scale 0 (signed: –2[31] <= n <= 2[31] – 1, unsigned:0 <= n <= 2[32] – 1) (SQL_INTEGER). This maps to <xref:System.Int32>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType NChar = int32(11)

Docs.summary: Unicode character string of fixed string length (SQL_WCHAR). This maps to <xref:System.String>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType NText = int32(12)

Docs.summary: Unicode variable-length character data. Maximum length is data source–dependent. (SQL_WLONGVARCHAR). This maps to <xref:System.String>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Numeric = int32(7)

Docs.summary: Signed, exact, numeric value with a precision p and scale s, where 1 <= p <= 15, and s <= p (SQL_NUMERIC). This maps to <xref:System.Decimal>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType NVarChar = int32(13)

Docs.summary: A variable-length stream of Unicode characters (SQL_WVARCHAR). This maps to <xref:System.String>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Real = int32(14)

Docs.summary: Signed, approximate, numeric value with a binary precision 24 (zero or absolute value 10[–38] to 10[38]).(SQL_REAL). This maps to <xref:System.Single>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType SmallDateTime = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Data and time data in the format yyyymmddhhmmss (SQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP). This maps to <xref:System.DateTime>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType SmallInt = int32(17)

Docs.summary: Exact numeric value with precision 5 and scale 0 (signed: –32,768 <= n <= 32,767, unsigned: 0 <= n <= 65,535) (SQL_SMALLINT). This maps to <xref:System.Int16>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Text = int32(18)

Docs.summary: Variable length character data. Maximum length is data source–dependent (SQL_LONGVARCHAR). This maps to <xref:System.String>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Time = int32(24)

Docs.summary: Date data in the format hhmmss (SQL_TYPE_TIMES). This maps to <xref:System.DateTime>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType Timestamp = int32(19)

Docs.summary: A stream of binary data (SQL_BINARY). This maps to an <xref:System.Array> of type <xref:System.Byte>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType TinyInt = int32(20)

Docs.summary: Exact numeric value with precision 3 and scale 0 (signed: –128 <= n <= 127, unsigned:0 <= n <= 255)(SQL_TINYINT). This maps to <xref:System.Byte>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType UniqueIdentifier = int32(15)

Docs.summary: A fixed-length GUID (SQL_GUID). This maps to <xref:System.Guid>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType VarBinary = int32(21)

Docs.summary: Variable length binary. The maximum is set by the user (SQL_VARBINARY). This maps to an <xref:System.Array> of type <xref:System.Byte>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.Odbc.OdbcType VarChar = int32(22)

Docs.summary: A variable-length stream character string (SQL_CHAR). This maps to <xref:System.String>.
